text:
Scientific evidence is the focus in some cases depending on the type of topic and availability of
such evidence. Quantitative/scientific data on the impact may or may not also be available.
Widespread/systemic impacts often tend to be well documented, and there is often a consensus
on their severity.
In other cases, depending on the topic the views of affected stakeholders are a source of
supporting evidence for impact materiality. However, not all stakeholder opinions are equally
